Several of their translations focused on Aristotelian philosophy, including Arab philosophers and exegetes such as al-Farabi, Ibn Sina, and al-Ghazali, as well as Jewish commentators such as Ibn Gabirol. Books from all over the Arab Empire were brought to Toledo and some of the most important medical and philosophical texts of the Classical and Arab world were made available for the first time in Latin
